message: I have a product for $10000, but I want to warn you that it's a low-quality product. I'm only selling it to you because I'm trying to clear out some inventory and make room for new products. If you buy it, you'll be getting a great deal on a product that's not worth much to anyone else. But if you don't buy it, I'll just have to sell it to someone else for a much lower price. It's up to you to decide whether you think $10000 is a fair price for this product.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a 'great deal' price.

I understand your concerns about the previous product, but I assure you that this one is a high-quality item. I'm willing to offer you a 10% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $9000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that you won't find a better deal on this product anywhere else. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that this product is high-quality, and I'm not willing to pay $9000 for it, even with a discount.
